But it is not possible in the new editor:

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

Pasting Anchor link in the address bar of the browser does not redirect the user to the precise location of the Anchor 

*Environment*

Confluence Cloud- New Editor(Fabric Editor)

Step 1- On a Page. Create Text Link and a respective Anchor. And publish the Page.

Step 2- Click on the Text Link(Associated with an Anchor on the same page) and copy its link address.

Step 3- Paste the copied link address in a browser address bar.

Step 4- The page will reload but not take you (user) to the precise location of the Anchor in the Page.

*Expected Results*

The user must be redirected to the precise location of the Anchor.

*Actual Results*

The Page gets reloaded but the user does not get to the precise location of the Anchor.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Anchor Link does not redirect the user to the Anchor location in a Page when address link is copy-pasted in the address bar (new editor)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
- A User using Deutsch as Confluence language and Profile language. However, when accessing the profile, the message under "you work with" is translated in the Czech language instead of Deutsch. Also, when accessing the profile and you want to change the profile image. 

h3. Environment
- Confluence Cloud 

h3. Steps to replicate
# Go to confluence, click on profile picture > Settings
# Change language to Deutsch and save

h3. Actual Results
- Accessing the profile, the message under "you work with" is translated in the Czech language instead of Deutsch

h3. Expected behavior
- Accessing the profile, the message under "you work with" should be translated to Czech

h3. Workaround
- None
fields.summary: Profile message is translated to Czech instead of Deutsch

fields.description:

When the homepage has Draw.io diagram and with Recently Used Label macro, the Draw.io diagram will intermittently throw an error.

{code}

fields.description:
In Confluence, when the user inserts the [Attachments macro to the page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/attachments-macro-724765160.html], the same will put the attachments in order and the user is able to sort it by different parameters.

In some cases, the users would like to configure the order manually so it can be displayed in a specific list. This is a suggestion to allow users to manually change the order to the attachments by manually dragging the file on the list.
fields.summary: Option to select attachments order in Attachments macro

fields.description:
As of the time of this writing, the editor used for page comments matches the old editor experience. This means that users are having different experiences between editing pages and making comments which can be confusing and may require additional training of team members to overcome.

For example, the new editor experience uses "/" to autocomplete insertion of macros, while the comment and old experience use "{" to autocomplete the insertion of macros.

To resolve this, I would like to suggest that the new editor be made to be (at least optionally) the editor in use on pages using the new editor experience.
fields.summary: Change Page Comments editor to new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When there're multiple edits on a single page, the e-mail notification sent will say "there's x new edits" instead of 'there're x new edits"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Ask multiple users to edit and publish changes to that page

h3. Expected Results
The e-mail notification sent should say "there're x new edits on this page"

h3. Actual Results
The e-mail notification sent says "there's x new edits on this page"

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect grammar on page edits e-mail notification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when the user is watching a space or a specific page, actions corresponding to them will be triggering a new notification email (e.g. creating/deleting a page, editing pages). However, for specific actions like editing or creating a page, those notifications are being delayed (in around 3 to 10 minutes).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, make sure to have a user watching the specific page (or the whole space)
# In this specific page used for the test, edit it
# Make sure to publish the new edit and have the user checking the email for a notification.

(i) The user can also try to create a new page on the space in order to trigger the corresponding notification.

h3. Expected Results
A notification should be sent to the same right after having the action performed.

h3. Actual Results
The edit/create page notification takes around 3 to 10 minutes to be sent to the watcher(s).

h3. Notes
* Mentions in comments do not seem to be affected. 
* Sharing pages also trigger the notification right away.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Delay in edit/create page notification email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is not possible to insert shortcut links in the new editing experience. The [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/configuring-shortcut-links-724765548.html] states that this functionality can be used via the advanced insert link dialogue but that is no longer present in the new editing experience.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a shortcut link definition via https://<host>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/browseshortcuts.action
 # Create or edit a page using the new editing experience
 # Insert a link using the shortcut link syntax link@key (ex. atlassian@google)

h3. Expected Results
Link is created using the expanded value of the specified key

h3. Actual Results
A broken link to [http://#|http:/#] is created

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to Insert Shortcut Links Using New Editing Experience

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, the user can work with the ability to assign tasks to different users by using the *action item/task* function, so the same triggers a notification that a task has been assigned to the user. When using the [Task report macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/task-report-macro-724765319.html] and publishing a page, the mentions on that will not notify the users included in the task list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(info) Prior to starting the steps, make sure that existing action items/tasks are already associated with users, so it can be displayed on the Task Report macro.
 
# Create/edit a page using any editor version.
# On the page, add the *Task report* macro.
# Configure the parameters to make sure that valid tasks will be displayed on the page.
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
As it happens with tasks, action should trigger a notification that the user has been mentioned on the specific page.

h3. Actual Results
No notifications for the mention/action item will be sent to the mentioned user.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Mentions/Assigned tasks on Task Report macro does not notify users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the user creates a table using the Legacy editor, if a table is big enough to trigger the sticky headers function, the same will only work sometimes. Depending on if the page is refreshed, or, accessed again, the function may not work again on Google Chrome.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, make sure to create or edit a page.
# Insert a table that is big enough to be scrolled down.
# Publish the page and try to scroll down using Chrome.
# If the function works, try refreshing the page a couple of times.

h3. Expected Results
The function should continue to work properly.

h3. Actual Results
The same works intermittently when the user is using Google Chrome.

h3. Workaround

Use Firefox. However, the intermittency can also affect Firefox, but, with less frequency.
fields.summary: Sticky headers intermittently working on Chrome

fields.description: While sharing a page, it would be effective if there is an option to set restrictions like *View or Edit* for the set of users whom we are sharing the page. so that we do not have to set restrictions separately from the Lock Button on the page or from the Restrictions option from the Dropdown list.
fields.summary: Option to add Restrictions on Page Share Feature

Confluence Cloud

  --header 'Accept: application/json'

*start parameter* to return starting index of the returned templates has no effect on the result.

h3. Issue Summary
WEBP images are broken on the pages

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

Images with WEBP format are rendering properly on the page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Not able to delete labels on a page which is copied from another page with existing labels.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and add a label to it
# Create a copy of the page which created in step 1.
# The new copy will have the label added to the original page.
# Try to delete the label in the new copy created in step 2.

h3. Expected Results
User should be able to remove the labels without any error.

h3. Actual Results
User is getting 'Error: GraphQL error: Unexpected HTTP status: 404' in the UI.
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-19 at 1.42.37 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
User is getting the same error when tried to delete the label from the original page as well.

h3. Workaround
 # Access the page
 # Open browser's console (right click on the page > inspect)
 # Select *Console tab*
 # Paste the code below (Remember to replace the instance name, contentid and label name):
{code:javascript} fetch(
    "https://{instance}/wiki/rest/api/content/{content_id}/label/{label_name}",
    {
        "credentials":"include",
        "headers":{
            "Content-Type": "application/json"
        },
        "method":"DELETE"
    }
).then((resp) => function(response){
    console.log(response);
}); {code}
# Press Enter
fields.summary: Not able to delete labels on a copied page

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 23 August 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Hi everyone, 

My name is Sam Ugulava and I'm a Product Manager on the Confluence Cloud team. Thank you for your feedback on resizing images by pixel in the new editor. The new editor optimizes for making sure images look good on all screen sizes, but your feedback helping us understand that the current resizing options may not provide enough flexibility for content creation. As a result, we are going to evaluate your feature request and consider enhancing the resizing options for images.

In the meantime, here's how you can resize images in the product today:

After adding an image to your page, its starting width is the same as the content area. 

To resize an image, 
 # Select it. Image handles will appear on each side.
 # Hover over a handle, select it, and drag it out from the middle or in toward the center to change the image size. 

Images snap to the grid that appears offering you eight image sizes providing a responsive experience for page viewers regardless of device.

Thanks again for your feedback, 

Sam  
{panel}
{panel:title=Status Update 13 March 2020 }
As we're working through this feature and others, we wanted to address a lot of your concerns as to the future of the new editor and legacy editor.

Please read our recent community post here: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476]

Thanks,
 Avinoam
{panel}
h3. Description

Resizing images by pixel has been removed in the new editor. There are many times when precision documentation calls for precise image sizes, down to the pixel. 

Additionally: The TinyMCE editor allowed to scale images to a percentage of their size.
fields.summary: Resize image by pixel on new editor

The [Jira Roadmap macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/roadmap-957979308.html] using Jira Next-gen projects displays the error "This doesn't look like a URL of Jira roadmap." when inserting the roadmap link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence test page
# Insert a JIRA Roadmap macro and insert your JIRA instance URL

h3. Expected Results

The macro should recognize the instance URL and present the available roadmaps to be selected.

h3. Actual Results

The site URL is not recognized and this error appears:
!Screen_Shot_2019-08-16_at_16_23_06.png|thumbnail! 

At the network call, you can see that the endpoint that validates the site URL returns "Invalid host for fragment".

h3. Notes

If you directly paste the road map page link into the Confluence page the macro will be automatically created but you will see the following when opening it:
!Screen Shot 2019-08-16 at 16.29.40.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workarounds at the moment.

Trying to create a page for new editor using the REST API isn't consistent

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When I view the differences between a page's version and the diff snippet contains a profile link, the URL of the link is broken.

{color:#1d1c1d}Current (broken): {color}[https://hello.atlassian.net/wikihttps://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/people/557057:67d1c0a1-99e7-4a48-a66c-0295a4549a89?ref=confluence]
{color:#1d1c1d}Correct: {color}[https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/people/557057:67d1c0a1-99e7-4a48-a66c-0295a4549a89?ref=confluence]

The profile URL seems to being resolved against the base URL of the confluence instance.
h3. Environment

hello.atlassian.net
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a blank confluence page
 # Create a new revision of the page, with a profile link in it
 # Diff the versions of the page and follow the profile link

h3. Expected Results

I am taken to the correct profile page
h3. Actual Results

I am taken to a 404 error page
h3. Workaround

A competent user can correct the URL in the browser, but they're still presented with a 404 which is confusing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence, when a .txt file has a script, when the user tries to download it, or, simply use the preview option in order to see it, the script code will not be displayed and instead, will only display blank content.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to have a .txt file with a script.
# Attach the same to an existing page and either put it with the preview option or, to *Show as a link*
# Tap the link (if tapping the preview option, the same will not render and will ask the user to download it) to download the .txt file.

h3. Expected Results
The file should be downloaded.

h3. Actual Results
The file is opened in a new tab and will only display the content that is not tied to the script. What is tied to the script will be blank.

h3. Notes
This is also affecting .csv files.

h3. Workaround

On the preview option, make sure to tap the *Download* button in order to have the file downloaded. For files displayed as links, access the *attachments* part of the page and there, use the preview to download it with thee *View* button.
fields.summary: Opening a .txt or .csv file with a script does not show or downloads the same

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Code Macro Administration settings do not appear to be applied to the Code Block in the New Confluence Editor

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud using the New Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Update the Code Macro Administration Settings (Confluence Administration > *Configure Code Macro* - direct link: https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/plugins/newcode/configure.action) and change the Theme and Language
 # Create a New Confluence Page using the New Editor and insert a Code Block

h3. Expected Results
Code block is themed based on the Code Macro Administration Settings

h3. Actual Results
No theming is applied and no Language Syntax is rendered (unless one was manually selected while in edit)

h3. Notes
The Code macro Administration Settings only appears to be applied to Code Blocks in the Old Confluence Editor

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Code Macro Administration Settings Are Not Applied to New Editor Code Block

fields.description:
We have a lot of users who open pages in edit mode for examining how things have been done or for copying macros and content for reuse at other pages, this to save time in configuring macros and formatting content.

 

When they are done, and have made no changes to the content of the page (or accidentally made changes), they press the "*Close*"-button and we gets "*UNPUBLISHED CHANGES*".  Or if they accidentally made changes, those accidental changes are there when the next person edits the page.

The users forgets that the "*Close*"-button = "*Save changes without publishing*" (close and save draft), and they forgets that they where supposed to use the hidden "*Revert to last published version*"-button.

Please rename the "*Close*"-button to "*Save and close*", and add a visible "*Discard and close*"-button = the hidden "*Revert to last published version*"-button.

 

Also set colors on the buttons
 * "Publish"-button can be green.
 * "Save and close"-button can be yellow.
 * "Discard and close"-button can e red.
fields.summary: Editor-mode: Rename the "Close"-button and add a visible "Discard and Close" button.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Sometimes teams or folks may use outside text editors to take notes from meeting actions before inserting them into Confluence.

The problem here is that simply copy-pasting those items with a "[]" at the beginning of them won't make Confluence recognize those as actual *actions*.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement this feature on the new editor so anything pasted with "[]" at the beginning is considered an action.
fields.summary: Ability to copy-paste actions from plain text into Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Confluence system apps are installed by anonymous users. 
When Confluence installs a system app, in the audit trail it shows the user name as `anonymous`. Ideally, it should be something that tells the customers that it was done by 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As an admin, Go to UPM audit logs https://your-instance.atlassian.com/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm/log?source=manage
# Look at auto updates / installs

h3. Expected Results
Auto updates / installs should show as done by Atlassian.

h3. Actual Results
Auto updates / installs show as done by `anonymous` user.


h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Confluence system apps are installed by anonymous users.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have an additional JIRA site and it is properly set up in the *Settings > Application links*, even so, it is not possible to link a project from this different JIRA site to a Confluence space on the *Integrations* option.

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*Make sure you have set the link between your current Confluence instance and the different JIRA site on *Settings > [Application links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/using-applinks-to-link-to-other-applications-779295829.html ]*
# Go to a space;
# Navigate to *Space Settings > Integrations > Application links*;
# Click over the *add link* button;
# You may see two JIRA options, one called *System JIRA (JIRA)*, which is the JIRA site with the same URL than your Confluence, and the other one - click on the other one;


h3. Expected Results
A Confluence pop-up is shown up for you to insert the project name or key from the JIRA instance you are linking.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot create a link from a Confluence space to a JIRA project when it is to a different site

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Connect app UI elements with addon_property_contains_any_user_group fail to display.

Related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-65625

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install an app with {{addon_property_contains_any_user_group}} (sample Atlas CRM)
 # Add which group to display in settings (https://<instance-name>.atlascrm.cloud/settings/permissions)
# Login as a regular user (non admin) with the appropriate group and notice that no "Atlas CRM" menu is available in apps

h3. Expected Results
It should display the appropriate module

h3. Actual Results
Not displaying

h3. Notes
* The vendor has had more than one occurance of this problem before:
https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/14/DEVHELP-2127
https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/14/DEVHELP-2266
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-65625
* They always track whenever customers change the user groups that they define in their Permissions page. The list of groups hasn't been changed for <instance added as internal comment> since September 2018.
* The customer (<instance added as internal comment>) has reported this to be broken before (See mentioned DEVHELP tickets) with the same app property, which was fixed by Atlassian, and now seems to be broken again.
* The same condition with the same app property works in Jira. (Vendor also have the menu item there) This was also the case when the conditions were broken before.
* I personally wasn't able to replicate this but vendor mentioned from experience from the past that:
{quote}
We haven't been able to reproduce this issue ourselves. We noticed in the past when the conditions were broken that a bug in confluence was rolled out to several customers of ours but not to everyone. (So it looks like updates come in batches on Cloud).
{quote}

h3. Workaround
Apps can work around the failure by temporarily removing the condition from their app descriptors.
fields.summary: Condition 'addon_property_contains_any_user_group' is not working intermittently

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: November 17, 2020}
 Hi everyone,

This is [~nagarwal@atlassian.com] from the Confluence team. There is already a user-level config you can set to default new pages to be full-width

You can update it under the user settings. Regarding full width for templates please follow https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-68312

 

!image-2020-11-17-17-24-54-317.png|width=221,height=237!

!image-2020-11-17-17-25-22-900.png|width=591,height=181!

Best,

Niraj

Developer, Confluence
{panel}
 

For many users, they view confluence nearly exclusively through the desktop app, or do not care that the viewing experience in the mobile app is changed due to the change in aspect ratio. For these users, they would prefer that new pages default to the full-width rather than the fixed width format.

For this, I would like to propose either a global or space setting that will default the new blank pages to using the full width rather than the current default fixed width. This would allow the users to choose a default that is sensible for them.
fields.summary: Global or space option to default new pages to "full width" page layout in new editor

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

On the legacy editor, it was possible to create pages using links, as described in our [Insert Links and Anchors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/insert-links-and-anchors-724764900.html] doc:
{quote}
h3. Link to an undefined page (a page that does not exist yet) 

Sometimes you want to link to a Confluence page that doesn't exist yet. To do this, you can add an undefined link and come back to it later. When you click on the link, Confluence will create a draft page with that title for you to then add content to and publish when you're ready.
h4. *Create an undefined page link:*
 # Choose *Insert* > *Link* or press *Ctrl*+*K* on your keyboard.
 # Choose *Advanced*.
 # Enter the name of the page to be created in the *Link* field.

A link to an undefined page is shown in dark red. Until you actually publish this newly created page, anyone with *create* permissions in that space can click on the link, while viewing or editing, and it will continue to create new draft pages. 
{quote}
(!) But that's not possible to be achievable on the new editing exprience.

h3. Suggested Solution
Bring this feature to the new editor.

h3. Workaround
No workaround available fo this feature.
fields.summary: Bring the option to create pages using links to the new editor

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of November 11, 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}

We just confirmed our plan to bring back support for basic search query operators including AND, OR, and NOT in the new advanced search experience. We plan to release it in the next couple of weeks.

This is a known limitation that we have planned to address shortly after completing the full rollout of the new advanced search experience.

Thank you for your patience,

Elaine, Confluence Cloud PM
 {panel}

Confluence Cloud

It doesn't filter the content correctly based on the CQL.
h3. Workaround

Use the old search experience by going to https://yoursite’sname.atlassian.net/wiki/dosearchsite.action

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we have a space starting with 0 (zero), the *Create from template* macro will generates a 400 error (bad request) if the space set is the one that starts with zero on the spacekey.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Both editing experiences

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space with the space key "_007_", for example;
# Create a page on this space and add a *Create from template* macro;
# Set any template, but let the spacekey set as _007_;
# Save the macro and publish the page;
# Hit the create from template button.

h3. Expected Results
You are redirected to the template you set.

h3. Actual Results
The screen just hangs on a creation pop-up.

h3. Notes
* When setting the spacekey in the *Create from template* macro, if you type _007_, it will show a *no results found* message. However, if you type the space name, the space will be listed and, when clicking on the space name, the spacekey _007_ is auto-filled in the field;
* If you right-click over the create from template button and inspect it, it is possible to see that the buttons is correctly set:
{code}<button class="aui-button create-from-template-button conf-macro output-inline" data-space-key="007" href="https://INSTANCE_NAME.atlassian.net/wiki?createDialogSpaceKey=007&createDialogBlueprintId=2b681b86-c745-4f9a-8302-2d116dbf6b55" data-content-blueprint-id="2b681b86-c745-4f9a-8302-2d116dbf6b55" data-hasbody="false" data-macro-name="create-from-template" data-macro-id="ee3eda4f-06d4-4d34-9bb9-0a4c3698c0f8" resolved="">Create from template</button>{code}
* However, the request URL is set to create the page in the spacekey *7*:
{code}https://saitama.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/create-dialog/1.0/blueprints/web-items?spaceKey=7{code}
Open the network tab in the browser console and hit the create from template button to receive the 400 and see it.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Create From Template macro - spacekey cannot start with 0 (zero)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we select a text on the page to get the 'Create Issue' option, the Dialog box is created on the very top of the page, rather than within the visible screen. 
The issue is not reproducible in the new editor.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any confluence page
# Scroll to the bottom of the page
# Highlight text
# Click create issue from the options

h3. Expected Results:  
'Create Issue' option Dialog box should show in the same place.

h3. Actual Results: 
'Create Issue' option Dialog box shows on the very top of the page (out of view).

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: 'Create Issue'  Dialog box shows on the top of the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some users can't retrieve the pages in Recently Worked on screen.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page
 # Checked Recently Worked on list

h3. Expected Results
 * Recently Worked On should show the lists of pages you've recently worked on, recently visited, drafts, and pages you've saved for later.

h3. Actual Results
 * Recently Worked On doesn't show the lists of pages you've recently worked on, recently visited, drafts, and pages you've saved for later.

h3. Notes

Using this link will show all the pages.
 - [https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/search?expand=version,container,metadata.currentuser.favourited,space,metadata.currentuser.lastcontributed&cqlcontext=%7B%22contentStatuses%22:%5B%22current%22,%22draft%22%5D%7D&cql=type%20in%20(page,blogpost)%20and%20id%20in%20recentlyModifiedPagesAndBlogPostsByUser(currentUser(),%200,%2020|https://intance.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/search?expand=version,container,metadata.currentuser.favourited,space,metadata.currentuser.lastcontributed&cqlcontext=%7B%22contentStatuses%22:%5B%22current%22,%22draft%22%5D%7D&cql=type%20in%20(page,blogpost)%20and%20id%20in%20recentlyModifiedPagesAndBlogPostsByUser(currentUser(),%200,%2020]

h3. Workaround
 - None
fields.summary: Recently Worked On does not retrieve pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A user who logs in to Confluence is required to have Create Issue permission on every project he/she wants to see, otherwise, the JIRA projects drop-down on Confluence won't show. For example, creating Software Project Space in Confluence.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Project
# Grant Jira Browse Project Permission to User A
# User A doesn't have Create Issue Permission to the project created in Step 2 
# User A creates a Software Project Space in Confluence. 

h3. Expected Results
User with Jira Browse Project permission should see the list of projects when creating space in Confluence.

h3. Actual Results
A user who logs in to Confluence is required to have Create Issue permission on every project he/she wants to see

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Projects drop-down list on Confluence depends on Create Issue permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the *Sprint Burndown Gadget* to retrieve a large board (with more than 100 reports/issues), the same will only display blank content, without the current content of the board in Jira.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, make sure to have a new page created
# In this page, insert the *Sprint Burndown Gadget* gadget
# Edit the gadget in order to point to a board with a large number of requests

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should retrieve the chart with the correct content from Jira.

h3. Actual Results
Only blank content is displayed on the gadget:

 !gadget.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Insert a link to the Jira report on the page, so the users will see the content properly.
fields.summary: Retrieving a large board with Burndown Chart Gadget does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It isn't possible to convert the text in bullet points into action items

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud - New Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add text, select it and convert them into bullet points
# Select the text and click on "Action item"

Remove the bullet point from the text and then convert it to an action item.

fields.description: As a feature of the collaborative editing resource, it would be nice to have a reviewing process on Confluence. When a user is creating a new page or editing it, it will only get published after someone reviews the page and approve the publishing.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It isn't possible to add text with space in between as action item

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud - New editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Add a random text
# Divide the text into 3 different paragraphs 
# Select the entire text and click on *Action Item* icon

h3. Expected Results
The text should become action items.

h3. Actual Results
It does nothing. 

 [^checklist.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Select each paragraph and click on *Action item*.
fields.summary: Not possible to add text with space in between as action item

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Since August 8th, a specific onboarding/walkthrough is being launched for users. It seems that it happens one time only. It will consist of three purple pop-ups, having the first one like the example below:

 !walkthrough.png|thumbnail!

However, under a specific condition, if the user access the page by using an external link (e.g. a linked page in a Jira case, or, a page shared through email) and the same is under a large page tree (that avoids the *Pages* part to be displayed on the sidebar), the pop-ups for the onboarding will not be displayed and the content will be all greyed out, without giving the users an option to proceed or close it to continue editing pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a new user to be tested in order to trigger the walkthrough
# Make sure to share a page located inside a sidebar with a large number of pages, so it will not have the *Pages* part displayed on the beginning of the page tree in the sidebar.
# Have the user accessing the link and being redirected to Confluence.

(!) As an important detail, only one customer mentioned about accessing through external sources, while the others confirmed that it is simply happening by trying to access pages. Both or only a single condition from these ones might be causing it.

h3. Expected Results
The walkthrough pop-ups should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The screen gets greyed out and a highlight in the *Pages* part is displayed in the middle of the sidebar.

h3. Notes

* The issue is not reproducible if you access the pages normally, or, a short page tree in the sidebar.
* The issue does not happen again if the user has already gone through the walkthrough. A feature flag might be needed to reproduce it.

h3. Workaround
Have the user manually accessing Confluence's dashboard (https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki) and then, go through a page in order to trigger the walkthrough/onboarding and finish it. It's recommended that the space haves a small number of pages as the condition of multiple pages can affect it, or, that the user goes directly to the *Overview/home page* of the space.
fields.summary: Walkthrough affecting on editing/viewing of pages in space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*Atlassian Update: September 16, 2021*

Hi Confluence Cloud customers,

Exciting news, we’ve recently released two Confluence Analytics APIs for more flexible access to your data! We’re thrilled to begin providing these for you.

Documentation for these are available here: [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-experimental/#api-wiki-rest-api-analytics-content-contentid-views-get]

Thank you again for sharing this feature suggestion and for sharing your feedback. For any further APIs or detail from Confluence analytics please open a new ticket so that we can gauge interest and feedback for each request.

Best,
 Emily Ditchfield
 Product Manager, Confluence Cloud
{panel}
At the moment, the Confluence Analytics feature that is bundled in premium, does not provide any REST API capability.

Suggestion :

Provide a REST API capability to extract analytics data from Confluence.
fields.summary: API option for Confluence Analytics

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the [Confluence Cloud Editor Roadmap page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-cloud-editor-roadmap-967314556.html?utm_source=product-release-email&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=Migration-Information-Comms-Cohor-1_EML-4381&jobid=104227625&subid=1205686342], we've discussed features that have been removed from the new editor. One of this feature is the "Change comment".
  !Screenshot_1258.png|thumbnail! 

Later on we've discussed obsolete macros with a link to the page [We're cleaning up the macro browser|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-the-macro-browser-946028471.html]. One of the obsolete macros mentioned is the "HTML comment" and the proposed workaround is to use "Change comment" (which is a feature that has been removed in the new editor).
 !Screenshot_1259.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
confluence.atlassian.com

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the page in the link [Confluence Cloud Editor Roadmap|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-cloud-editor-roadmap-967314556.html?utm_source=product-release-email&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=Migration-Information-Comms-Cohor-1_EML-4381&jobid=104227625&subid=1205686342]
# Find and read "Features that have been removed"
# One of the remove features is "Change comment"
# Read to "Obsolete macros"
# Click the link [We're cleaning up the macro browser|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-the-macro-browser-946028471.html]
# On the obsolete macro table find "HTML comment"
# Read the Alternative. It mentions using "change comment" (Removed feature)


h3. Expected Results
Removed feature should not be provided as the alternative

h3. Actual Results
A removed feature was added as the alternative

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inconsistency between provided alternative to a deprecated macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With the [editing improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], macros like "info", "tip", "note", and "warning" were split from the former [Panel macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-panel-macro/].

To add these macros, the user can either use the keyboard shortcut ("/") and type "Panel" for suggestions related to these macros or, tap the +/insert button to see the macro. However, if the user selects the *View more* option on the macro list and then, search or type "panel" (or any other variable of this macro), the macro is not listed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page using the current editor.
# *Edit* the page then tap *insert/+ > View more*
# On the opened macro browser, search for *panel* or any variables of the macro (I.E. "note", "warning", "info") by going through the list or typing its name.

h3. Expected Results
The macros should be displayed on the list.

h3. Actual Results
The macros are not displayed.

h3. Workaround

Use the keyboard shortcut that will provide a macro dropdown to have it added.
fields.summary: "Info", "Tip", "Note" and "Warning" macros are not displayed on the macro browser's search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In current versions of Confluence, users are unable to add Flickr URL links utilizing the *Widget Connector Macro*, which we [specifically mentioned|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/widget-connector-macro-724765314.html] should work with Flickr. When users add the Flickr URL with the macro, it does not render the content and instead displays a gear icon on the page.

h3. Environment

* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Edit any page and add the *Widget Connector Macro*
# In the *Web Site's Widget URL* parameter, paste the URL provided by Flickr for sharing an image.

h3. Expected Results

When adding the Flickr URL through the macro, it should display the image on the page.

h3. Actual Results

When users add the Flickr URL with the macro, it does not render the content and instead displays a gear icon on the page:

 !gear-icon.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

The current workaround would be to get the Embed HTML code for an image provided by Flickr and embed it to a page using the [HTML Macro for Confluence Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212279/html-macro-for-confluence-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=overview].
fields.summary: Widget Connector Macro no longer working with Flickr URLs

fields.summary: Page title is not aligned to the left side for pages created in the Old Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When having *editing* restrictions permission on a space, or even full permissions in this space, you are not able to change the restrictions in an existing page that is restricted to be edited. Once you try to add another user in the page restrictions, you receive a message:
"There was an error submitting the page restrictions. Please try again later."

h3. Environment
* Cloud
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
[^How to reproduce it.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
You are able to add the new user

h3. Actual Results
You receive an error when applying the change:
"_There was an error submitting the page restrictions. Please try again later._"
And it is not updated.

h3. Workaround
Add your user with editing restrictions on this page, and then add the other user.
fields.summary: Cannot change page restrictions even having full permissions in the space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to upload the new version of the file in the confluence page attachments. It keeps showing "Waiting for file changes from Excel" and it never completed and upload option remains disable.

 

Environment
Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a confluence page insert a file and publish the page.
 # Click on the attachment >edit file
 # It keeps showing "Waiting for file changes from Excel" and it never completed and upload option remains disable.

h3. Expected Results
The upload option should be clickable and the user should be able to upload the edited file.

h3. Actual Results
The upload option is greyed out and the user is unable to upload edited file.


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to upload the file update button is disabled and keeps showing "Waiting for file changes from Excel"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Confluence and Jira are linked, the user has the ability to paste the URL of a Jira request and it will be automatically converted into a [small preview of the macro in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/jira-issues-macro-724765217.html], including its type and status.

If the user uses different macros to retrieve the page excerpts where the pasted Jira URL is located, the same will be displayed as raw URL, instead of having the preview displayed on the original page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, create a page using the new editor or a blog post.
# On the page, make sure to paste a Jira URL from an existing Jira request from the linked Jira instance.
# Make sure that this pasted URL will be inside a macro like the *Excerpt* one. If in a blog, the user can simply paste the URL anywhere.
# On a brand new page using the new editor, insert a macro like the *Excerpt include* one and point its configuration for the previously created page, so we can retrieve the content that has Jira as well.
# For the blog one, you can simply create a new page and add the *Blog posts* macro and have the blog displaying full content on the macro.

h3. Expected Results
The excerpt from the original page should have the Jira request using its preview.

h3. Actual Results

A raw URL is displayed on the Jira request location.

h3. Workaround

Make sure to add the Jira request by using the *Jira macro*, instead of pasting it into the original page.
fields.summary: Pasted Jira issues display as raw URL when retrieved from macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When logging in or simply navigating through Confluence pages, some users are receiving the "Oops, you've made a malformed request" message. It is a known issue which we have a [public KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/oops-you-ve-made-a-malformed-request-when-resetting-atlassian-account-password-900816987.html], but it is happening with more frequency, lately.

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in on Confluence *or* navigate through the site.

h3. Expected Results
You are logged in successfully / you navigate as the usual.

h3. Actual Results
You receive an "Oops, you've made a malformed request" message suddenly.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Oops, you've made a malformed request" while logging in/navigating on Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment
 * Editor (tiny)
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # In a new or while editing a page in the old editor, add a new image between two different sections of the document, select it and change its text style to Heading;
 # Add a table of content; 
 # Notice that in the TOC preview it will be a blank space between the sections where the image was added.

h3. Expected Results

Not showing the blank space between the sections. 

!Screen Shot 2019-08-07 at 14.58.04.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The TOC preview is showing a space between the sections when the image is formatted as Heading. 

!Screen Shot 2019-08-07 at 14.59.06.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This is not happening when using Fabric editor. Also, in Fabric, it is not even possible to change the image text style. 

This is not affecting the TOC view after published. 
h3. Workaround

It is not really a workaround, but the page can be published normally with no impacts to the TOC even with this bug in preview.
fields.summary: Blank line is shown in Table of Contents' preview when an image is formatted as Heading in Tiny editor
Table width changes when comparing page versions
PDF Stylesheet to reduce image size is not working

fields.description:
Similar to issue https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-58055

 

Ideally after closing an unpublished page, confluence should redirect to the parent of the page.
fields.summary: Redirect to parent page (after close page / unpublished page )

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Online Diagram Software for Flowcharts like *Balsamiq, Draw.io or Gliffy* doesn't get published when a Jira issue macro is added to the same page. In Edit mode we can view the draw.io image, but in preview mode, it disappears.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a page
* Add both Jira Issue Macro & Balsamiq or Draw.io or Gliffy
* Publish the page


h3. Expected Results

* Both Jira issue macro & Balsamiq or Draw.io & Gliffy gets published

h3. Actual Results

Only the Jira Issue is published. Video Attached

h3. Notes
* It does work on Windows using Google Chrome;
* Doesn't work on IE and MS Edge

h3. Workaround

Jira Issue can be added as a comment on to the Confluence Page to load the Balsamiq/ Draw.io / Gliffy in Published Mode
fields.summary: Balsamiq, Draw.io & Gliffy Diagrams doesn't load with Jira Issue Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Comments by *anonymous users* on Pages does not send out an Email notification to watchers

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a public page (make sure that the page is not restricted, Space and Global Setting is public)
 # Publish and watch on the page
 # Open browser's incognito session and opens the public page
 # Comment on the page

h3. Expected Results
Email Notification is being sent 

h3. Actual Results
No Email notification being sent

h3. Notes
Email notification is sent if the comment is from an *existing users*

h3. Workaround
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Comment by anonymous user on Pages does not sends out Email notification to watchers
